newsitem.title: CANADA: SNC-Lavalin unit gets C$16 mln contract.
newsitem.headline: SNC-Lavalin unit gets C$16 mln contract.

text.p: SNC-Lavalin Group Inc said on Friday that its Chilean subsidiary has been awarded by the Andina Division of Corporacion Nacional del Cobre, a C$16 million contract for a copper concentrator expansion project.

The capital cost of the project is C$350 million. The SNC-Lavalin subsidiary's contract covers engineering management and construction, procurement services and project management. Work has begun and is scheduled to be completed in July 1998 and create about 100 jobs, mainly in Chile.

The plant, situated in Saladillo, about 120 km northeast of Santiago, will increase production in ore treatment from 33,500 to 64,000 metric tons a day, resulting in a production of 107,000 tonnes of fine copper annually.
